page.title: 12GARBOLDISHAM VILLAGE HALL.
page.content: The village hall, funded by local benefactors and by public donation, was built soon after W.War 2 on land given by the owner of "The Hall". Replacing a corrugated iron reading room, it is of brick and asbestos roof const. and has hall, kitchen, toilets and annexe. There is a portable stage but plans exist for a permanent stage and changing rooms in due course. Hire{CHARGES}are on a sliding scale; lowest for local clubs, highest for commercial use (Auctions etc) with local fund raising in between. The floor is set out for badminton and the hall is used for carpet bowls, plays, dancing, concerts, etc., by the local {CLUBS}and for private bookings. A Village Hall Management{COMMITTEE has the usual officers and members plus representatives from local organisations.
